templatetags Package¶

commenttags Module¶

class openassembly.pirate_comments.templatetags.commenttags.CommentForm(data=None, files=None, auto_id='id_%s', prefix=None, initial=None, error_class=<class 'django.forms.util.ErrorList'>, label_suffix=':', empty_permitted=False, instance=None)[source]¶

Bases: django.forms.models.ModelForm

This form is used to allow creation and modification of comment objects. It extends FormMixin in order to provide a create() class method, which is used to process POST, path, and object variables in a consistant way, and in order to automatically provide the form with a form_id.

class Meta[source]¶
exclude = ('user', 'object_pk', 'content_type', 'reply_to', 'submit_date', 'is_leaf', 'is_root', 'content_object')¶

openassembly.pirate_comments.templatetags.commenttags.pp_comment_delete(context, nodelist, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

This is rendered by the caching system when the user wants to delete a comment.

openassembly.pirate_comments.templatetags.commenttags.pp_comment_form(context, nodelist, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

This block tag can create or process forms either to create or to modify issues. Usage is as follows:

{% pp_comment_form POST=request.POST object=request.object user=request.user %}
Do stuff with {{ pp-comment.form }}.

{% endpp_comment_form %}

openassembly.pirate_comments.templatetags.commenttags.pp_comment_list_get(context, nodelist, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

we have to render the tree html here, because recursive includes are not allowed in django templates this could be more efficient with pre/post order tree traversal, but for now this suffices. mptt and treebeard both are not designed for GAE, need a tree traversal library for non-rel

openassembly.pirate_comments.templatetags.commenttags.render_comment(comment_obj, count, user, request)[source]¶
openassembly.pirate_comments.templatetags.commenttags.render_to_comment_tree_html(comment_tree, user, request)[source]¶

Comment tree in form: c_tree = [[Comment1, [Comment1_2, Comment1_3, Comment1_4]], Comment2, Comment 3] must be rendered as a <ul>...<li><ul> ... <li>render_comment()</li> ... </ul> </li> </ul>
